  physical_appearance: This is a Sanskrit Lexicon. It is compiled on inscribed palm leaf pieces. Each piece is rectangular in shape
 and has two holes in the center. There is a string by the compiled manuscript.

  subject_terms_1: inscriptions Sanskrit (language)

  subject_terms_2: Sanskrit language Palm-leaf inscriptions Dictionaries

  subject_terms_3: 

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: The Amarakosa (“immortal treasure”) is a lexicon of the Sanskrit language
 authored sometime between the 5th and 8th centuries
 and has had over 40 commentaries written to it. This palm-leaf manuscript of the Amarakosa originates from Sri Lanka
 dating to the early 19th century
 indicating the spread of the usage and study of Sanskrit
 and its continued prevalence even in the 19th century.

metadata.title_text: A Sanskrit Lexicon Sanskrit Lexicon Amarakosa
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a Sanskrit Lexicon. It is compiled on inscribed palm leaf pieces. Each piece is rectangular in shape, and has two holes in the center. There is a string by the compiled manuscript.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The Amarakosa (“immortal treasure”) is a lexicon of the Sanskrit language, authored sometime between the 5th and 8th centuries, and has had over 40 commentaries written to it. This palm-leaf manuscript of the Amarakosa originates from Sri Lanka, dating to the early 19th century, indicating the spread of the usage and study of Sanskrit, and its continued prevalence even in the 19th century.
